text: Cryphia ereptricula is a moth of the family Noctuidae. It is found in most of central and southern Europe, from Sweden and Finland, south to Italy and Greece and from Germany east to Belarus. It has also been recorded from Spain. The wingspan is 23–28 mm. Adults are on wing from July to August. The larvae feed on lichen and algae. ==References== Category:Cryphia Category:Moths of Europe Category:Moths described in 1825
title: Cryphia ereptricula
